title: Building pytorch without CuDNN?
body_html: I have an "old" gpu in my laptop (NVIDIA nvs5400m). This gpu has only a cuda compute capability of 2.1. CuDNN requires compute capability > 3.0, so pytorch gpu enabled mode can't run on my gpu. Is it possible to build pytorch without CuDNN, but only with CUDA support? I'm running on Ubuntu 16.04 with CUDA 8.0. If it's not possible, I will just switch to the cpu mode.
